TITLE.P: 81221812 — Financing Energy for Low-carbon Investment — Cities Advisory Facility (Felicity) — Technical Assistance for Project Promoters

SHORT_DESCR.P: Cities produce more than 75% of the global greenhouse gas emissions and are thus critical for the achievement of the goals set in the Paris Agreement on climate change and the Sustainable Development Goals. Urbanization and the unprecedented growth of urban areas, especially in emerging economies and developing countries, requires increased investments in low-carbon and climate resilient infrastructure. Yet, cities face significant barriers to prepare bankable projects, secure finance and implement such projects.

Felicity, Financing Energy for Low-Carbon Investment — Cities Advisory Facility, a joint Initiative by GIZ (Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit GmbH) and the European Investment Bank (EIB), addresses these challenges by aiming at closing the gap between urban development planning and infrastructure project financing.

Cities produce more than 75% of the global greenhouse gas emissions and are thus critical for the achievement of the goals set in the Paris Agreement on climate change and the Sustainable Development Goals. Urbanization and the unprecedented growth of urban areas, especially in emerging economies and developing countries, requires increased investments in low-carbon and climate resilient infrastructure. Yet, cities face significant barriers to prepare bankable projects, secure finance and implement such projects.

Felicity, Financing Energy for Low-Carbon Investment — Cities Advisory Facility, a joint Initiative by GIZ (Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit GmbH) and the European Investment Bank (EIB), addresses these challenges by aiming at closing the gap between urban development planning and infrastructure project financing. The initiative will provide tailored support to financial intermediaries and city administrations with a view to turn their low-carbon infrastructure projects bankable for EIB lending and to enhance their access to the benefits of international climate finance. The achieved lessons learned will potentially contribute to policy advice at the national level to improve the framework conditions for climate relevant investments. FELICITY is a global initiative financed by the Federal German Ministry of Environment under the international climate initiative (IKI) and envisages to start its activities in Brazil, Mexico and China.

Felicity primarily supports the capacities of cities and communities to prepare and implement projects. The support is directly linked with the intended financing by the EIB. This approach enables the partner organization systematically build knowledge and experience on international climate financing in the urban infrastructure sector. Furthermore, the selected pilot projects will serve as best-practice examples based on best available technologies and process innovation, which enables a demonstration effect.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: It is necessary to provide references in the technical field of urban infrastructure (worldwide and in Brazil, Mexico or China) with a minimum commission value of 75 000 EUR.

The technical assessment is only based on reference projects with a minimum commission value of 75 000 EUR.
